Token.Abstract:
AWS IoT

AWS IoT-Data enables secure, bi-directional communication between Internet-connected things (such as sensors, actuators, embedded devices, or smart appliances) and the AWS cloud. It implements a broker for applications and things to publish messages over HTTP (Publish) and retrieve, update, and delete thing shadows. A thing shadow is a persistent representation of your things and their state in the AWS cloud.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.

Returns the singleton service client. If the singleton object does not exist, the SDK instantiates the default service client with defaultServiceConfiguration from [AWSServiceManager defaultServiceManager]. The reference to this object is maintained by the SDK, and you do not need to retain it manually.
Creates a service client with the given service configuration and registers it for the key.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves the service client associated with the key. You need to call + registerIoTDataWithConfiguration:forKey: before invoking this method.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An instance of the service client.

Token.Abstract: Removes the service client associated with the key and release it.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

Token.Abstract:
Deletes the thing shadow for the specified thing.

For more information, see DeleteThingShadow in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteThingShadow service method.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An instance of AWSTask. On successful execution, task.result will contain an instance of AWSIoTDataDeleteThingShadowResponse. On failed execution, task.error may contain an NSError with AWSIoTDataErrorDomain domain and the following error code: AWSIoTDataErrorResourceNotFound, AWSIoTDataErrorInvalidRequest, AWSIoTDataErrorThrottling, AWSIoTDataErrorUnauthorized, AWSIoTDataErrorServiceUnavailable, AWSIoTDataErrorInternalFailure, AWSIoTDataErrorMethodNotAllowed, AWSIoTDataErrorUnsupportedDocumentEncoding.

Token.Abstract:
Deletes the thing shadow for the specified thing.

For more information, see DeleteThingShadow in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteThingShadow service method.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: The completion handler to call when the load request is complete. response - A response object, or nil if the request failed. error - An error object that indicates why the request failed, or nil if the request was successful. On failed execution, error may contain an NSError with AWSIoTDataErrorDomain domain and the following error code: AWSIoTDataErrorResourceNotFound, AWSIoTDataErrorInvalidRequest, AWSIoTDataErrorThrottling, AWSIoTDataErrorUnauthorized, AWSIoTDataErrorServiceUnavailable, AWSIoTDataErrorInternalFailure, AWSIoTDataErrorMethodNotAllowed, AWSIoTDataErrorUnsupportedDocumentEncoding.

Token.Abstract:

ReturnValue.Abstract: An instance of AWSTask. On successful execution, task.result will contain an instance of AWSIoTDataGetThingShadowResponse. On failed execution, task.error may contain an NSError with AWSIoTDataErrorDomain domain and the following error code: AWSIoTDataErrorInvalidRequest, AWSIoTDataErrorResourceNotFound, AWSIoTDataErrorThrottling, AWSIoTDataErrorUnauthorized, AWSIoTDataErrorServiceUnavailable, AWSIoTDataErrorInternalFailure, AWSIoTDataErrorMethodNotAllowed, AWSIoTDataErrorUnsupportedDocumentEncoding.

Token.Abstract:
Publishes state information.

For more information, see HTTP Protocol in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A container for the necessary parameters to execute the Publish service method.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An instance of AWSTask. On successful execution, task.result will be nil. On failed execution, task.error may contain an NSError with AWSIoTDataErrorDomain domain and the following error code: AWSIoTDataErrorInternalFailure, AWSIoTDataErrorInvalidRequest, AWSIoTDataErrorUnauthorized, AWSIoTDataErrorMethodNotAllowed.

Token.Abstract:

For more information, see UpdateThingShadow in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.
